snippet: A public showing of one of the few surviving copies of the 13th-century document was shifted to the British ambassador’s residence, with no explanation given.
abstract: China make unannounced change in exhibit site for Magna Carta, ground-breaking document written in 1215 that is celebrating its 800th anniversary with global tour; experts say quick venue change from Renmin University of China in Beijing to British ambassador’s residence is probably due to document’s democratic ideology, which runs counter to ruling Communist Party's authoritarian principles.

byline.contributor: Vanessa Piao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A public showing of one of the few surviving copies of the 13th-century document was shifted to the British ambassador’s residence, with no explanation given.

headline.main: Magna Carta Exhibition in China Is Abruptly Moved From University
headline.print_headline: Magna Carta Visits China, but Venue Abruptly Shifts
